item.title: कुङ्कुमादिः
item.description: Beware store-bought colors. Eg. 2016 yellow shrIchUrNam lead poisoning White source The white clay that we purchase from the shops or from temples nearby comes majorly from tirunArAyaNapuram, tiruvahIndrapuram, ayodhyA and few other divya kshterams where this white clay is found. Yellow procedure Make in small batches. (Else harder to dry, fungus growth.) Directly use turmeric powder Optional additives to improve consistency 5-10% thirumaN Rice flour Classic procedure here. tirumaN/ chandana + turmeric I do archanA to mahAlakShmI using turmeric.

item.title: सदाचारः
item.description: श्रीचूर्णम् शास्त्र-निषेधः असंस्कृतां हरिद्रां यो मुखे लिम्पन् नराधमः। तन्मुखं न निरीक्षेत चण्डालम् इव न स्पृशेत्॥ इत्याह उत्तमूर्-स्वामी प्रयोगमालायाम्। कथं स्ंस्कारः? कुङ्कुमं चन्दनं चैव करूप्रञ्चानुलेपनम्। विष्णुगात्रपरामृष्टं तद्वै पावनपवनम्॥ इत्याह गोपालदेशिक आह्निकार्थप्रकाशिकायाम्। ईश्वरसंहिता च (आह्निकार्थप्रकाशिकायाम् उद्धृता) - कुङ्कुमं वापि हारिद्रं चूर्णं विष्ण्वभिषेचितम्। ऊर्ध्वपुण्ड्रस्य मध्ये तु धारयेद् दीपवद् द्विजः। Color traditions Many of the parakala matha sishyas use red even now. That said, in the 1990s, I have seen tenkalais wearing yellow srichurnam. The numbers have reduced now but I do see a few of them even now sometimes.
